alert.note: Alert for Deer Lodge; Granite; Ravalli; Silver Bow (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 18 at 11:39AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...INCREASED RISK OF HEAVY RAIN SUNDAY, WITH POTENTIAL FLOODING IMPACTS TO FLOOD PRONE AREAS, INCLUDING BURN SCARS AND URBAN AREAS... Atmospheric moisture associated with Hurricane Hilary will move across the Great Basin into southwest Montana Sunday afternoon. Thunderstorms will be capable of producing heavy rainfall, with localized rainfall rates in excess of 2 to 3 inches per hour. Flood prone areas, including burn scars and urban areas, will be at risk for rock, mudslide, debris flows, and flooding impacts. Flood prone areas include Butte, Anaconda, Philipsburg, the Interstate 90 corridor between Drummond and Bearmouth, and burn scar areas. Ultimately, hydrologic impacts will strongly depend on the track and strength of the remnants of Hurricane Hilary. Given this uncertainty, a wide array of rainfall amounts and potential impacts currently exist.

area.areaDesc: Deer Lodge; Granite; Ravalli; Silver Bow
